Articles.Content:
So, eventually money will be coming to KSP. However, it doesn't seem to be in the Kerbal spirit to just call them Dollars and denote them with the usual $.

Anyone have any ideas for Kerbal money?
Well, the Dev's say it may be called Kash.
Being Kerbals, they should call it "Krash".
I want it to be called kebits, and kebytes for larger amounts
I vote for "kredits".
My vote's for Kerbucks; if not, they could at least use that for the name of their main supplier of koffee (kaffeine?)
I do like kredits. Not a huge fan of Kash.
Instead of Kredits, I think KerBits might be more apropriate for the kerbin system.

kwhy kshould kit kall kstart kwith kK?

kNova kwould khate kthis kidea.
How about Koins(Coins)? Krubels(rubels)? Kerbjamens(Benjamins)?
Yeah, Kash.

Adding "ker" to everything gets old fast.

That said, using k instead of c can sometimes "feel" appropriate, so I'm down with "kredit", "kash" or even "MasterKard" (most space programs don't actually hand over real money when paying contractors, you know!)
Dogecoins.
Obviously it should be Krona the Swedish Currency.

Obviously it should be Krona the Swedish Currency.

Even though SQUAD is based in Mexico?

Obviously it should be Krona the Swedish Currency.

Sweden is the land of video game development.
I'm voting for kerbits.

Even though SQUAD is based in Mexico?

Yes because Krona was the first real world currency I could think of that started with K and because Keso just sounds too much like queso when I say it in my head.
Kold (Gold). They are probably smart enough to not use a fiat currency. ;-)

Even though SQUAD is based in Mexico?

Kuesos? Quesos?

Mmm...queso....... #homer

Why is Krona the best of these?

KAK: Cambodia/Kampuchea

KARBOVANETS (KARBOVANTSIV): Ukraine

KINA: Papua New Guinea

KIP: Laos

KOBO: Nigeria

KONVERTIBILNA MARKA (KONVERTIBILNIH MARAKA): Bosnia & Herzegovina

KONVERTIBILNA PFENIGA: Bosnia & Herzegovina

KORUNA (KORUN, KORUNY): Czechoslovakia, Czech Republic, Slovakia

KRONA (KRONOR): Sweden

KRONE (KRONEN): Austria, Bohemia, Romania

KRONE (KRONER): Denmark, Norway

KRONUR (KRONA): Iceland

KROON (KROONI): Estonia

KUNA (KUNE): Croatia

KUPON: Ukraine

KUPONI: Georgia

KWACHA: Malawi, Zambia

KWANZA: Angola

KYAT: Burma/Myanmar

Yes because Krona was the first real world currency I could think of that started with K and because Keso just sounds too much like queso when I say it in my head.

Which makes PERFECT sense, if you're a kerbal! Think about it: a space program that can only develop and grow using cheese-based transactions! Mmmm... cheeeeese.....

EDIT: Dangit capi3101 ninja'd me!

Edited December 19, 2013 by Deadweasel

Why is Krona the best of these?

KAK: Cambodia/Kampuchea

KARBOVANETS (KARBOVANTSIV): Ukraine

KINA: Papua New Guinea

KIP: Laos

KOBO: Nigeria

KONVERTIBILNA MARKA (KONVERTIBILNIH MARAKA): Bosnia & Herzegovina

KONVERTIBILNA PFENIGA: Bosnia & Herzegovina

KORUNA (KORUN, KORUNY): Czechoslovakia, Czech Republic, Slovakia

KRONA (KRONOR): Sweden

KRONE (KRONEN): Austria, Bohemia, Romania

KRONE (KRONER): Denmark, Norway

KRONUR (KRONA): Iceland

KROON (KROONI): Estonia

KUNA (KUNE): Croatia

KUPON: Ukraine

KUPONI: Georgia

KWACHA: Malawi, Zambia

KWANZA: Angola

KYAT: Burma/Myanmar

I sell Volvos so Swedish Krona was the first one that came to mind.

Which makes PERFECT sense, if you're a kerbal! Think about it: a space program that can only develop and grow using cheese-based transactions! Mmmm... cheeeeese.....

EDIT: Dangit capi3101 ninja'd me!

Although I think you might be changing my mind. Kqueso?? Keso? Keusos?

Although I think you might be changing my mind. Kqueso?? Keso? Keusos?

Keso. Definitely keso (pl.: kesos).

Kuesos? Quesos?

Mmm...queso....... #homer

Giving the Kerbals love of snacks.... I could see that working.
